pull_request.title: feat(expr): support jsonb `-` and `#-` operator
pull_request.body:
I hereby agree to the terms of the [RisingWave Labs, Inc. Contributor License Agreement](https://gist.github.com/TennyZhuang/f00be7f16996ea48effb049aa7be4d66#file-rw_cla).

## What's changed and what's your intention?

Add the following functions:
```
jsonb - text → jsonb
jsonb - text[] → jsonb
jsonb - integer → jsonb
jsonb #- text[] → jsonb
```

we reuse the `Subtract` expr type for the `-` operator.

This PR also bumps jsonbb version for a new API `contains_key`.

## Checklist

- [x] I have written necessary rustdoc comments
- [x] I have added necessary unit tests and integration tests
- [ ] I have added fuzzing tests or opened an issue to track them. (Optional, recommended for new SQL features #7934).
- [ ] My PR contains breaking changes. (If it deprecates some features, please create a tracking issue to remove them in the future).
- [x] All checks passed in `./risedev check` (or alias, `./risedev c`)
- [ ] My PR changes performance-critical code. (Please run macro/micro-benchmarks and show the results.)
<!-- To manually trigger a benchmark, please check out [Notion](https://www.notion.so/risingwave-labs/Manually-trigger-nexmark-performance-dashboard-test-b784f1eae1cf48889b2645d020b6b7d3). -->
- [ ] My PR contains critical fixes that are necessary to be merged into the latest release. (Please check out the [details](https://github.com/risingwavelabs/risingwave/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md))

## Documentation

- [x] My PR needs documentation updates. (Please use the **Release note** section below to summarize the impact on users)

Support the following operators:

```
jsonb - text → jsonb
Deletes a key (and its value) from a JSON object, or matching string value(s) from a JSON array.
'{"a": "b", "c": "d"}'::jsonb - 'a' → {"c": "d"}
'["a", "b", "c", "b"]'::jsonb - 'b' → ["a", "c"]

jsonb - text[] → jsonb
Deletes all matching keys or array elements from the left operand.
'{"a": "b", "c": "d"}'::jsonb - '{a,c}'::text[] → {}

jsonb - integer → jsonb
Deletes the array element with specified index (negative integers count from the end). Throws an error if JSON value is not an array.
'["a", "b"]'::jsonb - 1 → ["a"]

jsonb #- text[] → jsonb
Deletes the field or array element at the specified path, where path elements can be either field keys or array indexes.
'["a", {"b":1}]'::jsonb #- '{1,b}' → ["a", {}]
```

issue.title: `show columns` reports error on any tables
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

`SHOW COLUMNS` cannot work. I am quite shocked why our e2e tests still passed.

### Error message/log

```text
unexpected field count in "D" message
```


### To Reproduce

The psql history:

```
dev=> create table if not exists t3 (v1 int, v2 int, v3 int) append only;
NOTICE:  APPEND ONLY TABLE is currently an experimental feature.
CREATE_TABLE
dev=> show columns from t3;
unexpected field count in "D" message
```

`./risedev slt -d dev -p 4566 -u root e2e_test/ddl/show.slt` somehow returns ok for the test.
```
[cargo-make] INFO - Execute Command: "sqllogictest" "-d" "dev" "-p" "4566" "-u" "root" "e2e_test/ddl/show.slt"
e2e_test/ddl/show.slt                                        .. [OK] in 4139 ms
```

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### How did you deploy RisingWave?

_No response_

### The version of RisingWave

 PostgreSQL 9.5-RisingWave-1.3.0-alpha (unknown)
31d6dc01b543631ed13888760d1fc8ee365d649a

### Additional context

_No response_

pull_request.body:

issue.title: hummock: block decode function receives impl Buf
issue.body:
Currently, the block decode function receives `Bytes`, which requires the underlying buffer must be continuous. It's optimized when the block is not compressed, but not convenient for common usages.

To solve it, the block decode function should receive `impl Buf` for common usage, and can also receive a continuous buffer optimization.

comment.body: Checked the code and found that the non-continuous stream interface is not good for checksum calculation, I've tried to introduce ring buffer in foyer to solve this.

comment.body:
> I am quite shocked why our e2e tests still passed.

That's because `sqllogictest` only checks the return rows against to the row desc in the response.

issue.title: Implement java adapter on connectors of other streaming systems
issue.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

For streaming systems developed with longer time, they have richer ecosystem on both source and sink connector. In these systems, they usually define a general interface in java, and the connectors only to implement the defined interface so as to decouple the connector runtime driver and the connector implementation.

Therefore, we may consider developing an adapter in java to port the connectors implemented in other streaming systems to our system so that we can share the richer ecosystem.

Example: flink's [source](https://nightlies.apache.org/flink/flink-docs-master/api/java/index.html?org/apache/flink/table/factories/DynamicTableSourceFactory.html) and [sink](https://nightlies.apache.org/flink/flink-docs-master/api/java/index.html?org/apache/flink/table/factories/DynamicTableSinkFactory.html) general interface.

### Describe the solution you'd like

_No response_

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
